intro: Gilia candida, commonly known as the white gilia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States and parts of Mexico. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant produces showy, white to pale pink flowers that bloom in summer, attracting pollinators like bees and butterflies. It typically grows in open habitats such as meadows and rocky slopes. Gilia candida is often used in native plant gardens due to its ornamental value and ecological benefits.
